statement:
The following theorem involves Eilenberg-MacLane spaces in relation to
cohomology groups for connected CW-complexes.

Cohomology group theorem for connected CW-complexes ([@MJP1999]):

Let $K(\pi,n)$ be Eilenberg-MacLane spaces for connected $X$, Abelian
groups $\pi$ and integers $n \geq 0$. Let us also consider the set of
non-basepointed homotopy classes $[X, K(\pi,n)]$ of non-basepointed maps
$\eta :X \to K(\pi,n)$ and the $\overline{H}^n(X;\pi)$. Then, there
exist the following *natural isomorphisms*:

$$[X, K(\pi,n)]  \cong \overline{H}^n(X;\pi),$$

Related remarks:
----------------

1.  In order to determine all cohomology operations one needs only to
    compute the cohomology of all Eilenberg-MacLane spaces $K(\pi,n)$;
    (source: ref [@MJP1999]);

2.  When $n = 1$, and $\pi$ is *non-Abelian*, one still has that
    $[X,K(\pi ,1)] \cong Hom(\pi_1(X),\pi)/\pi$, that is, the conjugacy
    class or representation of $\pi_1$ into $\pi$;

3.  A derivation of this result based on the fundamental cohomology
    theorem is also attached.

[9]{}

May, J.P. 1999. *A Concise Course in Algebraic Topology*, The University
of Chicago Press: Chicago.,p.173.
